meanings.definition: The soft underside of an animal's body.
meanings.sent1: The puppy's underbelly was warm and fluffy.
meanings.sent2: The cat stretched out, exposing its underbelly for a belly rub.
meanings.sent3: The underbelly of the rabbit twitched as it hopped around playfully.
meanings.sent4: The underbelly of the whale glistened in the sunlight as it breached the surface.
meanings.sent5: Children love to tickle the underbelly of a giggling puppy.

meanings.definition: The vulnerable or weak part of something.
meanings.sent1: His underbelly of fear made him hesitate before taking the leap.
meanings.sent2: The underbelly of the plan was the lack of backup options.
meanings.sent3: Facing his underbelly of insecurity, he decided to seek help.
meanings.sent4: The underbelly of doubt crept in, clouding his judgment.
meanings.sent5: She knew the underbelly of his argument and countered it effectively.

meanings.definition: The hidden or darker side of a place or organization.
meanings.sent1: The underbelly of the city was filled with secrets and shadows.
meanings.sent2: Exploring the underbelly of the internet can reveal both wonders and dangers.
meanings.sent3: In the underbelly of the school, students whispered forbidden tales.
meanings.sent4: The underbelly of the company's dealings was finally exposed to the public.
meanings.sent5: She delved into the underbelly of the organization, uncovering corruption.
